problem_statement: Find the distance of a point (2, 5, -3) from the plane r·(6i - 3j + 2k) = 5.
overview: We use the perpendicular distance formula from a point with position vector ū to a plane r·n̄ = p, given by δ = |ū·n̄ - p| / |n̄|. By substituting the given point and plane values, we can compute the distance step by step.

step_details.explanation: First, identify the position vector of the given point and the normal vector of the plane.
Recall the formula for the perpendicular distance δ of a point from a plane:
Compute the dot product of the position vector ū with the normal vector n̄.
Substitute the dot product and the value of p into the numerator of the formula.
Now compute the magnitude of the normal vector n̄.
Finally, substitute the values into the distance formula to get δ.
